intro: Hieracium × zapalowicksii, commonly known as the hybrid meadowhawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with dark centers. The plant typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It has palmate leaves that are often hairy and can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Due to its hybrid origin, it exhibits a variety of morphological traits that distinguish it from its parent species.
